Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: lotus and palmette frieze with added red on calyxes; below, pair of narrow glaze (fired brown) bands; below, black with traces of two narrow red bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd probably belongs to the same vessel as Ure Museum 26.2.24(a). For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0401.555.a, 1888,0601.555.b, 1888,0601.555.c, 1888,0601.555.d and 1888,0601.555.e, and see also Payne 1931, 154, fig. 62. The sherd is published in CVA Reading I, 34, pl. 21, no. 26 as a fragment probably from a skyphos. For examples of the lotus flower and palmette frieze to separate friezes on Corinthian column-kraters, see the work of the Sphortos Painter in Amyx 1988, 508, pl. 120.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 34, pl. XXI, no. 26 bis)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.049) (Phase 1)
